div.h2: Q How is the school communicating information with its families?
div.p: A Updates will be shared via ParentSquare and on the MPA Community page on Facebook. Answers to specific questions may also be found on this FAQ page. A COVID-19 hotline email address has also been set up here at Menlo.
div.h2: Q What if my student did not attend school on Friday, March 13 and didn’t get their Chromebook/materials?
div.p: A If your child was absent when Chromebooks, chargers and materials were sent home on Friday, March 13, you should have picked up items on Monday, March 16. If you did not, you can call the school at 440-925-6365 to see if your student has a packet for pick-up.

A The school has received enough cleaning wipes that every teacher in the school has a supply. Additional wipes are deployed in the cafe. The school is wiping down “high touch” surfaces several times a day. We have also scheduled a deep cleaning with our vendor that will take place this weekend.
For cleaning Chromebooks, follow these tips.
div.h2: Q How does my student stay connected to Menlo Park Academy during this shutdown?
div.p: A All 2-8 graders will be sent home with a Chromebook/charger and some educational materials. More information is forthcoming for K-1 students, including appropriate online materials.

We intend to begin online learning next week (the week of March 16). Our faculty members are finalizing their plans on Monday so that an update on our virtual education plan for all grades will be shared early next week, including detailed information and instructions on how to access Google Classroom and other resources.
div.h2: Q What if my student doesn’t have access to the internet?
div.p: A We suggest families look to libraries and other free community hotspot sites to gain internet access. If you would like to rent a Google hotspot, here is an option.

For families in the Comcast service area, this internet provider is offering one free month of service to low-income families. Spectrum may also be offering free or discounted internet service. Spectrum may also be offering a discounted or free plan for low-income families. Please call Spectrum at 1-844-488-8398 to find out more.
div.h2: Q What if my K-1 student doesn’t have access to a device?
div.p: A Please contact karen.uthe@menloparkacademy.com to have your name added to the list.
div.h2: Q What about free/reduced lunches...can my student still participate while school is closed?
div.p: A Here’s what we know so far:

Menlo Meal Service – Menlo is offering breakfast and lunch to all our families regardless of their Federal meal program status or city of residence. The meals would be the typical breakfasts and lunches that we serve during a regular school day. Breakfasts are cold and don’t need refrigeration, such as a meal bar and fruit. Lunches are the typical lunches served in the sealed container for families to warm up at home.

We will also be offering meals next week (during our regularly scheduled spring break days). During the week of March 23, the day for pick up will be Tuesday, March 24 from 11 a.m.-12:30 p.m. If you elect to participate, you will receive seven breakfasts and seven lunches per student. Click here to complete the form so that we know how many meals to order. We need this information by this Friday, March 20 at Noon in order to provide the information to our vendor.

Menlo’s Little Free Pantry – Our LFP effort is going well. The bins are near the main entrance wooden doors (not car line doors). Please continue to leave what you can and take what you need. Note that when the building is closed, the black gate to enter the property may be closed, but it is not locked. You can slide it open when you arrive on the property and we ask that you please close it after you leave.

li.p: CMSD Meal Service – The Cleveland Metropolitan School District (CMSD) is offering meal pickup service at several locations for all children (18 and under) who live in the city of Cleveland. This service will begin on Monday, 3/16 and is open to all students from Cleveland regardless of which school they attend. See the linked document for details on pickup locations and times.

2. Food Bank Partners - The Greater Cleveland Food Bank partners with more than 1,000 programs and agencies in Northeast Ohio. Please check their website https://www.greaterclevelandfoodbank.org/partner-agencies/list for local food pantries, or to find a program near you, call their Help Center at 216.738.2067.

div.p: We are committed to continuing to provide meals to our students during this challenging time for families.
div.h2: Q What if my student or our family need Counseling Services?
div.p: A Our Counseling Team is available via phone and email to talk to your student and you during this time. Please email Director of Counseling David Berenson to make these arrangements.
div.h2: Q What is the status of the Costa Rica trip?
div.p: A Our independent tour company, ACIS, canceled this trip as of Thursday, March 12, 5:30 p.m. We are in the process of notifying families involved.
div.h2: Q What is the status of the Malley’s orders?
div.p: A We will receive our Malley’s delivery in late March and will set up a distribution plan closer to that time. More updates soon.
div.h2: Q What guidelines are being suggested for families and staff traveling during break?
div.p: A While health officials are advising citizens across the country to avoid nonessential travel, we are aware that plans are already in place for some staff and families for spring break. We ask that travelers refer to the CDC’s travel guidelines and communicate with our school administration via the COVID-19 hotline as to where you have been if you travel outside of Ohio.
div.h2: Q What if I have questions about COVID-19?
div.p: A For questions about COVID-19, including testing and reporting, you can call one of these hotlines or your healthcare provider. Menlo Park Academy has no knowledge of any confirmed cases. Please email our COVID-19 hotline with specific questions related to Menlo Park Academy and COVID-19.

li.p: Cleveland Department of Public Health, 216-857-7473 (in Cleveland)
Cuyahoga County Board of Health, 216-201-2000 (in Cuyahoga County)

div.h3: Menlo Park Academy - 2149 West 53rd Street, Cleveland, Ohio 44102 - (440) 925-6365
